The crime of slighting the warnings of reproof as stated in our Saviour's words "whosoever shall not received you nor hear you," &c., insures the penalty which he has pronounced against such offenders and makes them subject to the great displeasure of God. This sin, if not repented of, not confessed, but still retained and cherished, will bring them, in the sight of God, into a position worse than 
                                                                           3
wicked Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of Judgment, because they had greater light than they of the doomed cities.
